titleStmt.title: Thomas J. Hall et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6834

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Shepherdsville Ky
23 Augst 1865
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlette
Govr of Ky
Sir
The Undersigned ask to represent to your excellency that at the present term of the Bullitt Circuit Court, upon a presentment for keeping a Tippling house A. P. Quint, was fined Sixty Dollars --

Mr Quint did not undertake to defend the presentment. On the contrary acknowledged his fault -- We are satisfied it was his first breach of law, in this particular and that he will not offend again and we take pleasure in recommending his case as one deserving executive clemency to the extent of your power -- Which we hope will be extended to Mr Quint

Thos J. Hall Sheriff B C
Lloyd Friddle
L Hoglan
P J B C C
Wertly Phelps
J, D, Hudson
R. J. Mayler
W. J. Colbow
S A McKay
R. H. Field
J R Dupuy
Com' atty
John L. Helm
J DeWitt Dundee
Tho W Riley
Wm Wilson
Wm J Heady
H. M. McCarty
Wm R Thompson

Bullitt Cir Ct
vs
A P, Quint
$60.
Pardon --
Remit
2d Sept/ 65
